active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the pros and cons of agent-based vs. agentless posture assessment in Zero Trust for IoT devices. Consider evasion techniques like spoofing or exploiting check intervals, and discuss scalability in hybrid/remote environments. Support arguments with real-world examples (e.g., Mirai botnet).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Architecture and Engineering (Domain: Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Zero Trust Architecture Vulnerabilities > Continuous Verification Architecture Gaps > Device Posture Assessment Weaknesses). Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Zero Trust Architecture Vulnerabilities > Continuous Verification Architecture Gaps > Device Posture Assessment Weaknesses. Generate 30 high-quality flashcards (aim for 5 per Bloom's level) optimized for Anki/Quizlet using university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy progression, active learning integration, 4-layer scaffolding, voter consensus (completeness on evasion/spoofing/IoT, pedagogy emphasis). CONTENT SCOPE (Complete/Synthesized from Research: Portnox.com/device-posture, NIST SP 800-207, SentinelOne.com/endpoint-security): - Foundation (Layer 1): Definitions, prior knowledge (ZTA, endpoint basics), big picture (resilient ZTA for hybrid work). - Components (Layer 2): Weaknesses - Incomplete data (blind spots/outdated), Evasion (spoofing, assessment windows, agent tampering, IoT/legacy limits), false pos/neg, scalability. - Implementation (Layer 3): Agent vs. agentless, mitigations (ML anomaly, frequent/random checks). - Integration (Layer 4): ZTA defense-in-depth, optimizations. Use provided Learning Objectives, Active Learning prompts, Scaffolding layers exactly for alignment. Follow Flashcard Schema strictly: MCQ front/back JSON format, distractor protocol, detailed explanations with sources/tags. Output ONLY a JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {...}, 'tags': [...]}, ...]. Ensure variety: 10 Remember/Understand (Layer 1-2), 10 Apply/Analyze (Layer 2-3), 10 Evaluate/Create (Layer 3-4). Tag each with 'hierarchy_level6', relevant weakness, Bloom's.
